metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1160 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Netatalk before 3.1.12 is vulnerable to an out of bounds write in dsi_opensess.c. This is due to lack of bounds checking on attacker controlled data. A remote unauthenticated attacker can leverage this vulnerability to achieve arbitrary code execution. It was discovered that Netatalk did not properly handle certain input. A remote, unauthenticated attacker could use this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

netatalk - 2.2.5-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netatalk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.5-1ubuntu0.2').
